lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons. We'll jump into the game here shortly, but we have some quick announcements to get through. First and foremost, congratulations Sam on his Emmy win! (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You suck!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I did it, guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thanks to one of our wonderful sponsors tonight, I was able to add an Emmy to his inventory from my phone just moments ago!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It says "Emmy Award of Exempla--" It won't tell me the rest of the title! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exemplary Talent.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This enchanted statue was given to the finest of "creatives in the land. It's a large thinly-coated lead icon made of cheap material." I'm going to take a picture of that later. That's so cool!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That object brought to you by our first sponsor tonight and sponsor for the campaign thus far, our friends at D&D Beyond. Sam?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They are contributing $100 to 826LA for every natural one we roll. Also, as part of their massive 826LA charity initiative, we're past the $10,000 tier, so D&D Beyond has offered up the discount code "826LA" for 25% off their awesome Legendary Bundle, which includes all the digital materials available on D&D Beyond. Last week, to honor that, I had dug through the archives and found a commercial that D&D Beyond had run in the '80s. We did a staged reading of it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fans wrote in and said, "Sam, you missed part of that story." The ad campaign in the '80s was not successful. However, it launched the career of the young actress who played Gail in the commercial. She was given her own spin-off sitcom on CBS. It only ran four episodes, and those episodes have been lost to time. But I was able to find the script of a promo for the sitcom starring Gail, from the D&D Beyond commercial, from the 80s!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Really?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Brought to you by D&D Beyond. I'll be playing Announcer; reprising their roles will be Laura as the mom, Taliesin as the dad, and Ashley The Johnson as Gail.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gail!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (announcer voice) "This fall on CBS, it's the hilarious sitcom everyone's "stoked" about: "You've Got Gail!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There are holes in all of my business pants!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gail!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Take a chill pill, Mrs. Henderson! I need those crotches for my Home Ec project!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This says, "Sew a quilt of fabric

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oops! (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That lovable scamp Gail gets her foster parents, the Hendersons, into totally "gnarly" situations.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did you do your chores, Gail?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not so fast, young lady. I found my tuna casserole in the garbage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No doy, Mrs. Henderson! You said, "Take out the trash," and it was the stinkiest thing in the house.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But it's not all fun and games. You've Got Gail also tackles serious issues.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gail, your friend from school was just in a car accident. She was drunk driving.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Henderson.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You won't believe the trouble Gail gets into every Thursday night!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gail, why didn't you do your report on First Ladies?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Because current First Lady Nancy Reagan gave me some bitching advice!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What kind of advice did Nancy Reagan give you?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: When teacher says, "Do your homework," just say no!

lines.name: TALIESIN, LAURA
lines.text: Gail!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Henderson!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Presented by D&D Beyond! (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god. It just gets better!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The character of Gail is amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If Yasha ever leaves us this campaign, you already have a backup character.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I ask how you spell "doy?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: D-O-Y.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Due to unforeseen circumstances--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam. Thank you, D&D Beyond, for making this happen. We have another sponsor returning this week: our friends at Obsidian for

lines.name: PEII
lines.text: You don't have to have played the first one to play the sequel, because they have built in a way that gets you up to speed very quickly and basically choose your decisions that you start the game to still influence the story and where you're going. A lot of the main characters in the story are voiced by us here at the table! Which is awesome. For a free DLC download, you'll be able to download the portraits of Vox Machina as well as voice sets to use in the game for your main character and entire party. Check it out if you haven't had a chance yet. It's an awesome RPG series. Unbiased as I couldn't possibly be because I was one of the first Kickstarter backers before I was even part of the game. It's great. I really enjoyed it. Check it out if you can. It comes out next week on Tuesday, May 8th. You can order it at versusevil.com/criticalrole. They've released almost all the portraits so far, just in the past couple of days. They've released Keyleth and Grog today.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keyleth's was adorable!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's a real angry--!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just a Vidal Sassoon face right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can see the bits of food flying out of his mouth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe tomorrow they unveil Gilmore.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That had been released already?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you to our friends at Obsidian for allowing us to be part of this awesome game.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh man, I am going to play that game. That is saying something, because I have no time for my own physical or mental health! It's going to happen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am definitely going to be playing that game, like right after the baby's born.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You'll have time. Get a wireless headphone so you don't wake him or her.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Me. Don't wake me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Just play. It'll be great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Super excited to see you! We are also super close to our $50,000 stretch goal for our 826 charity that we're pushing. If you can, donate now to 826LA.org/criticalrole. Every dollar you donate will be doubled, thanks to our fantastic Critter, Mark, who has been so amazing in supporting this endeavor. When we hit $50,000, I believe you will be running another one-shot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Another honey heist! More bears are back in town.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Make it happen.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) The bears are back in town!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She does that every week to recap what previously happened in case you're too busy running around to get caught up on what happened if you missed it, but you still want to be here live. Talks Machina is next Tuesday at 7 PM Pacific, where our fantastic Brian W. Foster will bring a few of us into his fold for the night to discuss what happened for tonight's episode you're about to watch. Oh man, we're getting out of here. Podcast from last week is available, where all fine podcasts are available to download, so keep up with that. That's it! We're good! Done! Anything else?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nice. That was a lot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wow, you are so late on that!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nah, it was timed about how I wanted it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back, everyone. As we watch Laura complain about her macaroni salad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it like tuna in here? What's in here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is the content you tuned in for.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there tuna in here? I think there is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No one really knows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Macaroni salad is the Wild West of culinary delights.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's the tuna casserole you were talking about.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not supposed to have tuna! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've delved into some of the mysteries of the beacon that you maintain. You've retrieved your Forever Alcoholic Flask. That's where we'll begin today. Friends, as the early morning creeps up upon you, the chilled morning air has left a bit of ice and mist crawling across areas of the city floor, from outside your window here in the Leaky Tap tavern. However, though it is a gloomy morning, there is already a general air of celebration around. Glancing across, more people are now shifting out into the street and city around you. Music is beginning to creep into the vicinity, and you can hear muffling through the nearby walls.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well struck, my lord!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (high voice) Well struck, my lord!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you all awaken, hearing this outside, what do you wish to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) It's a celebration!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your spidey sense is tingling?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Can you hear the difference?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It sounds like there's very expensive things to drink and eat. I'm going to get my pocketbook.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lots of pockets to pick!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Lots of bar brawls to start. Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I ask a retroactive question? Caleb, and maybe Beauregard, read all of Siff's journal?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Was anything more to be gleaned from reading the entire thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just more understanding of the same notes you read before. From what remains of the tome, you managed to quickly grab the Cliff Notes of it as you glanced through it, and the more information you pulled from it filled out that your thoughts on those tidbits were correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, and then the only other question I have is I don't remember what time of day the party ended the day. If there was time I would've used paper and scrolls to transcribe into my book, if there was time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's been a few days. You would've had time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it the morning?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is the morning. You have awoken--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to spend a minute focusing on the mote and get a point!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On the what? The mote?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There before you, you see the strange gray mote, and you reach out in the way that you saw Caleb's hand reach. At that moment, you feel it shift and vanish into your chest, the warmth sifting into the center of your rib cage and then your eyes focus once more, and you're back in your chamber.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, that was kind of cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you know that we have a special weapon now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do as of right now with you telling me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not exactly sure how it works, but it's really cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you feel all right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel really powerful and stuff, inside.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like how much more powerful?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like five percent.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Punch me. I want to tell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I'll punch her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, roll an attack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't punch her very hard. I'm going to pull my punch, because I only rolled a five.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That sounded like "pooing my pants."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, if you're not dodging.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm like, come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, then you hit her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I hit her? Yes! Okay, so now I roll for damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well it's one plus your strength modifier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Four damage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take four points of damage from a sheer punch to your shoulder!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Holy shit, Jester! What the fuck?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Rawr!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ow! Okay, that's awesome.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have dead arm?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, if I punch you in your ass you'll get dead leg. Have you ever tried it? Yeah, I punch her in her butt and try to give her dead leg.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, I think she is dodging this one so roll for this one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh man, come on! What do I add to it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say you're proficient in unarmed because you're just punching, sure. You add your strength modifier and your proficiency modifier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is shit. Oh plus the proficiency. No, it's still not enough. It's like nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She does manage to step out of the way, now being more defensive from giving her a dead leg.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I move and do a little hip bump. Get out of the way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wasn't trying to hit you anyway. I didn't want to hit you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just a little hip action, I've been working on it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Anyway, I have this thing, and I could've used it then to really hit you but I'm not going to. I'm going to save it for something really powerful. Are you in the room, Yasha?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel like I slept outside? I was going to interact. I think I slept outside. I forgot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we're all up and moving at this point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you ask this question, Yasha is not in the room.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Jester. That was you who said something when you were talking to the Xhorhasian assassin about babies not being born, or something like that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did I say something like that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think you were like, "Oh no, the babies!" Something about babies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He had said that this thing would help them with having babies, yeah. I would assume if we have it then he won't be able to have babies.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know how that town crier was talking about kids being stolen? You think they're connected?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Probably. That's really smart, Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks. I wanted to run it by you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where was it happening? It was along the border, huh? In Nogvurot? Yeah, that's where it was happening.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You have a good memory.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispering) Where is that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nogvurot is along the border.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know there's a garrison out there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter) Northward.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a map.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it near Xhorhas?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I brought it back in, didn't I?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, it doesn't count as using your memory if you're reading it, Jester. Come on! That's not fair.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't read it! I'm pulling my map out now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nogvurot is actually northward, a little bit east of Rexxentrum.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Right there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's not at all where I thought it was. I thought it was over by the Ashguard Garrison, but it's not. Yeah, weird. Maybe it's not connected, then. Unless there are a lot of them, the bad guys, in Nogvurot, which we could check out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I heard a rumor last night that more are getting through. I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wonder how. I wonder if there's an underground passage that people aren't seeing or something. Or maybe they can go invisible. Or maybe they have an airship! Or maybe they can turn into mist, and fly through the air where people can't see them. I've heard of people doing that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All possibilities, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (knocking) Y'all up?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord! Come in!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm naked! I'm not naked.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord! There's a celebration going outside!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can hear them. I think we're going to head downstairs if y'all want to join.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes! I run outside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you guys start heading downstairs. Who all is gathering down there with them?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everybody!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, everybody. Yasha, you napped in the side alleyway in the open air, sleeping with one eye open, being careful. As you wake up in the cold morning mist, the mist has caused this dampness around your chin and hair--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Around my glorious beard?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your glorious beard, right there. Frost beard.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't have a beard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. It gets really cold in the early morning and bits of frost have gathered at the edges of your hair, so you brush off it a bit. As you gather yourself and look out past the street, the music's already starting to swell very strongly from a distance, and a few musicians come by playing on their own. Some folks are starting to rouse and begin cooking things. The smell of meats and fresh morning meals are beginning to find your nostrils, and you decide you probably should check in.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I'll go check in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You come in, the rest of you all gather in the bottom tavern area of the Leaky Tap. What would you like to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does anyone know how this festival works? What are we celebrating again?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The close of the harvest.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's just for funsies and we go around and sample wares and things?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott, have you never been to a festival?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've been to a festival.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's general revelry. You know: drink, eat, dance.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not a big one. You know, small ones.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: About what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, end of the season and beginning of the season. You know, that sort of stuff. People's weddings, that sort of thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She is now also coming to consciousness. She's coming around to preparing the bar. Passed out, face down. Looks to be in her early 50s or so, long black hair that goes just past the chest area--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The chest area?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Respectfully choosing words, Laura. Past her heaping bosom? What do you want me to say?!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think you've had enough.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right around her titties? The titty area?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Take that tuna away.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's making you weird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Laura Bailey, forward-thinking feminist! (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's all right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Once you have a child, I want you to turn on a dime like a Tartuffe character and be matronly and severe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't curse!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's not going to happen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't talk about titties!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway, this female you haven't seen before who's in the process of running the bar, very much in the same way that you saw Wessek the dragonborn, or previous before that, Claudia.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) I wonder if that's the new owner.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Wait, what's she look like? Did you say something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Human, 50s, long black hair.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Past the tatas.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I bet that's her. Oh, that's right. I got so distracted by you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll walk in and give them a nod, and then go get an ale. First things first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What can I get you?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Just a big a drink, an ale.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For this part of the festival-- are you going for an ale or a stiff drink?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: An ale. It's morning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Slow burn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I wonder if the new proprietor knows there is a dead person in the basement.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not a dead person. It's a skeleton. It seems old. I mean I suppose it's a dead person.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is exactly what it is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I guess so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was it a dead human or a dead tiefling or a dead--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It seemed human-ish.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well there were no horns, and when you're a skeleton your ears are rotted away so I do not know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It could've been an elf.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It could've been.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there any people, I don't know, juggling and shit? Or any shows going on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not in the tavern currently. It seems most everyone outside is walking in one direction, though. A lot of the folks that are starting to gather are all heading past the entranceway and heading in a leftward path from looking out from the tavern.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we join them?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I want to see.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I definitely want to see this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You can carry booze in the streets here, right? It's like Vegas? Open carry?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait! No, not open carry. Open container.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. You have seen people walk with various drinks in their hand without an issue before.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm very much about this. We'll get that to-go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How was the new lady? Was she nice, was she a bitch?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: She just, I mean, she gives you your drink, so I think it's a nice woman to me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What was her name?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have no idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I bet she's a bitch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why would you say that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know. Because I want to buy this place, so I don't want to like her.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you know that there is a dead person in the basement here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe we can use that to run her out!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's a skeleton in the basement, apparently.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I sort of agree with Nott on this, I think there comes a point where it's a skeleton and not an actual dead person at this point. I mean, I know it is a dead person.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think that's correct, actually. I think it's both things at the same time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think there's a point where it's like a piece of fruit, but it's been out so long that even conceiving of it as a piece of fruit is not useful.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a good point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am pretty sure that's incorrect.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you call a cherry pit a dead cherry?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I start walking towards the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could you still eat the body? If you can't eat the body anymore then it's not a person.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can eat anything if you are determined enough.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That is also a very fair point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fjord has left the Schrödinger's skeleton conversation.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fjord, don't you dare have fun without us! I'm rolling out the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Molly gives chase.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I chase after them too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll put on my mask and join.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Slam down my-- go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point now, the chilled late morning beneath the cloud covered skies, the streets are filled with all manner of people and families walking with baskets and colored streamers behind them. The large banners of silk of the autumn colors that were previously being placed up in the streets are in full display. The gentle wind is causing them to flicker and flap as the music weaves with the sound of the fabric. Small bands of bards and musicians mark nearly every street intersection, filling the air with music, poems, and cheer. It's a very stark difference to the lock-down that held the city over the past week and a half or so. The closer you begin to follow the crowds as they move along, hearing the chuckles of children and the conversations and laughter that seem to burble out of every street corner, it pushes you in the direction of the Pentamarket. That's when the smells of spices and incense begin to come in waves as you follow the sauntering crowds, eventually that smell overcome by the smell of cooked meat pies and roasted vegetables billowing from the various food carts that line the corners of the streets before you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to be at Ren Faire.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The flickering of the wind is now this weird syncopation that's blending with the sound of the distant drums and ocarinas and flutes that are beginning to pipe into the strange din in the streets. You see a number of games of skill and chance that have been set up in the distance too, amongst the crowds, as people begin to weave through. To the left, you can see someone loudly proclaiming, "Want to play Trebuchet, anyone?" and down the way another voice calling out, "King's "Vault!" You can see more games in the distance beyond there. More stages are set up with food and it's a veritable smörgåsbord of celebration. What do you guys want to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Trebuchet sounds pretty fucking sweet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we're immediately heading to Trebuchet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do you mean? Is Trebuchet like a trebuchet?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How the fuck do we know? We're going to find out, though.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you fire it? Do you sit in it? I don't know. There's only one way to find out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to start walking towards the other one, the king's thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All by yourself, Caleb?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going with Caleb. Want to come?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to get thrown in a trebuchet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go with them, then.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Does it seem like there are more guards around than usual? Are the guards relaxed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The guards are relaxed, but there's definitely a large presence, and in fact, a number of the games are run by the guards. In fact, Trebuchet, as you approach, you see two guards, male and female, that are both in the process of lifting a three or four year old girl, and she has a sandbag in her hand. They're like, "One, two, three!" and she throws it and it gets close, but stops before the basket, but they cheer her on, "Yay!" and set her down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aww, I thought they were going to throw her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like a wonder child!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't worry. If she falls, they kill her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The kid runs off and grabs the bag and comes back and they lift her again. They go, "One, "two--" and they give her even more of a swing so she gets a little more distance. It hits the edge and then tips off to the side and they go, "Aww" and the crowd who had gathered around "Awws" with her. The little girl smiles and gives them a hug and then runs off. One of the guards turns as you guys begin to approach and shouts to the crowd, "Trebuchet, anyone wish to play?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes. Most definitely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Five copper for three throws."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Here's ten copper for Molly and me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sipes?" The other guard goes, "All right," pulls up three of the sandbags and hands them to you. "That basket there and that line there." You see that they were in between for the kids' reach, but there's about a ten-foot distance of small, thin carpet that's placed behind the line leading to this open wicker basket that's about a foot and a half wide. You have to throw overhead, facing away.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we need to pick them up and do the thing like you did with the child?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You are more than welcome to try. I'd love to see that happen. That is not necessary."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, it's all right. Let me try it on my own first. For dignity's sake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you stand there, you take the sandbag and in a trebuchet-like motion, lob it overhead without quite looking, assuming the direction. Go ahead and make a dexterity check with disadvantage please.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You lob it and hear, (pained grunt) and everybody goes "Oh!" and you turn around.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorry, friend. Yeah, that's a purple heart, sorry man. Jeez.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You turn around. You can see the mother of the small kid that was first throwing, and she's rubbing the side of her face.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You hit a mother.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Find her a soothing-- something to take the pain off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She goes, "Ah, it's fine." Looks up at you and goes, "Come on." She grabs her kid's arm and they both leave deeper into the crowd.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You should have let me and Yasha pick you up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. I've got this. Resituate. Grab a bit of a glance. (grunts)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, try again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's another natural one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Cha-ching!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you, one, two--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This happened at Ren Fair before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go to heave the sack, and as it does, it gets caught on part of your breastplate and as you pull upward there's a (ripping) as sand goes scattering into the sky around, emptying the bag and pouring over you into your eyes. (spitting) Laughter starts to gather in the crowd around and some small clapping.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Again, again!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can't believe I'm about to say this, but let's give it a try.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll get on the other.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. That's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, you have one more throw."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what I mean. I got them helping me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Which one of you is taking the other throw?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no. We're going to pick Fjord up the way that you did the little child.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, perfect. There you go."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Two shit throws in a row. It can't get any fucking worse.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on, one! Yes! Yes! Yes!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes! Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's ridiculous!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Seriously?! Throw that away!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You need to put that shit in jail.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You shouldn't have hit that woman with a sandbag.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's all right. You got them out of the way. When we fight a basilisk later, all those ones are gone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester, Yasha. How do you want to do this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We throw Fjord.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I don't think we help him. We just (whoosh).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They literally shot put Fjord about three or four feet. (surprised grunt)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did we get him in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. He gets about four feet before he goes face first into the carpet. The carpet balls up in front of him as he skids for another foot, foot and a half, with his feet up in the air before they come to rest. There's a dust cloud. There's a loud gathering of voices going, "Ooh" and then silent as the music plays in the distance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ow, my pride.

lines.name: ASHLEY, LAURA
lines.text: Molly!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The female guard goes and straightens out the carpet to get it right. "Five copper."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, he paid already.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh that's right. Then, by all means."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a dexterity? With disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you're looking away. It's not a hard DC but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19? (whoosh) (thud) "Whoa!" The crowd begins cheering. "Yeah!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay Molly!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They hand you a second one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does he get a prize?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "At the end."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I may have to-- I've spent my luck. I think it may be off to you and then one for you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Three throws. One each.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: By all means, Jester.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jester, use these.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! Oh, no!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's still not terrible.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I rolled two twos.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester. You throw it with all your strength, and it goes straight up. Hits you in the top of the head and dangles off one of your horns.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did it mess up my jewelry?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Here, hold on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait. Right, let's just--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Don't let it snag the earrings.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you. Go Yasha!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We suck at this.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Just let me do it. I know I'll get it in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it arcs, it lands. There's a little poof of dust behind. It only gets about four feet from you, unfortunately.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's like a weird shape, you know?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It changes in the air.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hardly know, but I've thrown a baby before. Odd.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "However, we do have one successful in!" and they reach over into a satchel on the side and pull out-- "A fresh strawberry for the victor."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's it? A strawberry?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it red?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's delicious.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mmm. Mm-hmm.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How much for a strawberry?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, we don't sell the strawberries. You can buy them further in. Here, you pay for the "prestige of a victory and a strawberry. If you get all three, you get a candied apple."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (muffled) Tastes better with the victory.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, what was the other game? Forget this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Caleb and Nott are already there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While this was transpiring, you guys go to catch up while Caleb and Nott have approached the young half-elven woman who is shouting, "King's Vault!" As you approach, you see she has her hair tied back, and she's barking with this utmost confidence. "King's Vault! Come play! Anyone, come "to the front! Show us your majesty of attention!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, what sort of game is it that you are running?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, you place either a silver or a gold piece up and I will--" and she pulls up three silver cups. "I will place it underneath one of these. Mix it around. Pay attention. Guess the "right one. Get your coin back plus one. Get it wrong, coin stays with me. Simple game."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I just so happen to have three silver on me. It takes one silver to play?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes. At least."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: At least. Well, I am feeling lucky today and always. Here it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Onto the table." She takes the center cup (click). Cup's over it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm looking. I'm going to hold my wire up to my mouth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. That being the case, I would like you both to roll a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does my Keen Mind help me at all in this situation?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Strangely, it does not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as she finishes the rotation, she stops and goes, "Very well," and you, has to be the right one. Has to be the center.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will go with the center one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's the one on the right!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think it is this one right here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The right one. No! You're getting the wrong one! The right one!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will go with the middle one. I think it's probably the correct place.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She tips the cup. Indeed the silver is there. "Congratulations! With that, your earnings "doubled," and gives you a secondary silver.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you want to do anything here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'd like to compete please.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I give her my two silver. Do me proud.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A silver?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now there's a small crowd gathering. Now people are starting to watch. There was a victory apparently, and some cheers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am going to back up like five or six steps and also do the same thing Nott did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Choose." Now go ahead and roll a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You were paying attention. All of a sudden, you lost it. Looking up at her eyes, you were so caught off guard by her staring at your fairly well-concealed goblin visage, but seemingly not enough, as she has a curious raised eyebrow. That spooks you for a second. You go "Oh, shit!" You lost track of the cups.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I got a total of 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Total of 20. On the perception? Okay. "What are you going to pick?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will choose-- eenie, meenie, miney.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do I get a chance to whisper to her what I saw? Because I want to do the same thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a sleight of hand check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, that's not so good. That is a six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you begin to pull your hands up and mutter your incantations, she goes, "Ahem. No "funny business."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, I am a funny guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I could tell. Ha ha. Now?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to pick the one on-- the middle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Aw. A good try." Scoops the coin off the table.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I failed you, Caleb! I'm so sorry. I took your silver, and I let it go. I'm sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but you know also, the other day, you gave me 200 gold, so it's not really a problem.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know, but it's the principle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well if you have 200 gold, you are more than welcome to place a gold piece up here as well."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're okay. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I give her the stink-eye as we walk away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Take care of your green friend there."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I intensify the stink-eye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fjord covered in dry dust.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I won a strawberry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fjord can't throw.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you have a different kind of dream?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: N-- No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Beat again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He won a silver, but I lost it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What game did you play?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was called King's Crown.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: King's Vault.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's what I said.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, the one where they spin it around and you see which cup it is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She was very quick, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I wonder if there are any more games.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the sense that everyone has been waiting to get to this festival, to this moment here. It's a much different atmosphere than the gala you had seen a week before in the Tri-Spires.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: TALIESIN Quite a party.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to find the most ridiculous mead out there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, there are quite a few mead stands, so it's easy enough for you. Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Meat or mead?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to find the candied apples.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Very easy to find through a couple of sleight questions to some of the noncompetitive barkers. You manage to find a small meadery stand that's near the outskirts of one of the large arena structures, that you haven't seen used since you arrived in this city. As you approach, the older guy there, with this curled and unkempt chin-beard that looks like part of it isn't growing on the right side. You approach and he has all this thick, dark jugs of mead, and he is like, "Hey, you want some mead?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, do you have mead that doesn't taste like piss?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have mead that'll get you fucked up."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That'll do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Might taste like piss still."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He did not answer your question.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That'll do, pig.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's your highest proof mead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just in a strong mead way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Slightly vinegar.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Still smells like piss, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Welp, depends what you want. Do you want strong or do you want tasty? You got to pick."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Strong.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah, good choice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That'll be a nice, fair filled cup. For a silver."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This about when I run up: What'd you get?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Barbarian pee, but it's good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What are the options?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He pulls up three jugs. He says, "This end, tasty. This end, fuck you up. This one, little bit "of A, little bit of B."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take whatever's most expensive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grabs the same stuff that Beau got, the heavier, thick stuff. Pours, gives you a cup full of it. "That'll be a silver piece."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It sets well, and it's

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're celebrating anything these days.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yasha!

lines.name: ASHLEY, LAURA
lines.text: We should go play this game.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I was really looking forward to looking for ridiculous meats. Not meads, but maybe we can--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, meat sounds great too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, the day is young.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Let's go play this game.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not play, crush this game.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We get a candied apple, okay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You approach the four soldiers that are up there. One of them comes up to you, the one who has the hammer at his side after retrieving it from the last person, goes, "Hey all right, are "you willing to play some Titan's Grasp, eh?"

lines.name: ASHLEY, LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, it's five silver an entry."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: ASHLEY What's the prize?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Single swing, but winner gets the current pot. Which stands at--" and he turns to one of the other guards who goes through a small bag and goes, "That's going to run about 43 gold."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm so sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, one swing. You?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, yes, yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "One swing for you."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Two swings.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Two swings? Shit, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Take as many as you want. No one's turned it over this morning yet."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can you rage at this thing when you--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's what I was going to try.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS, ASHLEY
lines.text: When in doubt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Who's going first?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yasha can go first.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I'll go first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to wait to give him my money because I have a feeling Yasha might win. I'm going to wait.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, I like that. Your friend's got confidence in you. All right, big missy." Hands you the heavy hammer. It's not too heavy in your grasp.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, Yasha!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It might be intentional. It's your turn, people start gathering. You're up on an elevated two foot platform there. They have the metal bar fulcrum, all set beneath the stone. Hammer's in your hands, what do you do?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, so I would like to rage. Ah! Just strength?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a strength check, yeah. You have advantage while you're raging. Roll twice, take the higher, and add your strength modifier.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oof. Okay, 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. (grunts) (ringing impact) You hit the metal bar, the stone (scraping) falls back into rest. It's a heavy stone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are we trying to do here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The stone is resting on the lower part and there is a fulcrum round centerpiece to it. You're trying to hit on this end to push the stone to roll over. It moved slightly and falls back into place. "Good try! That was very strong there, lass. Don't worry."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, I have another go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well pay another."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I did. I gave you ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh you did? Tell me this when you're counting this, bud. Go ahead, second swing."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You get another swing, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get advantage while raging, so--

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yasha!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now suddenly the crowd around, that you didn't notice gathering, start cheering: "Yay!" Looks over to the one guard who had the pouch, "Okay then, congratulations."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hands it over.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I count it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would be 44 gold worth but it's mostly silver pieces.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh shit, how much--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: About seven feet away, out of habit, Caleb just went: (counting).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That will buy us so many candied apples.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Who wants in?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: She's next.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, well all right. Five gold is-- all right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll toss in a gold piece just to make it interesting.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yeah, no, I'll do that when I see you going in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What!? You guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The guards are going, "Wait, into the--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're going to play, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: For the game, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will take that bet. I'll bet against her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got one gold that says she cannot do this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm the booker, so you pay me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think that's how that works.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I roll for strength check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yup, roll a strength check, add your strength modifier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20! (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (resounding impact) As you slam down again, the stone goes (impact). It rolls over a second time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Two in a row.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seemingly, the fulcrum set after you knocked it over prepared her for a better slam. As it hits, the four soldiers of the Righteous Brand look at each other, "We're going to take a break "here for a second. Return here in about 30 minutes." They hand the money over to you get five, six gold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seven gold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here's one gold. I just wanted to fire her up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks, Nott. It worked.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're going to inspect the hammer, inspecting the fulcrum, inspecting the stone, and they're basically in the process of wondering if they had somehow been cheated out of this. They can't find anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I skip away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point now, the smell of warm, candied fruit begins to waft past you. You glance over and can see there is a large cart that is selling all sort of sweet fruit that have been coated in sugar. Some have a sticky syrup exterior, and there are candied apples available for purchase. Depends on how much you guys want to purchase, if any.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I would very much-- I have never had a candied apple before.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have to try them. They're so good!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've never had a candied apple before? It seems so basic. It's honey and an apple.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, the candied apples are hard, right? The caramel apples are softer. Do you have caramel apples?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see the older woman who's there, who a little bit portly with a big smile, rosy cheeks, pulls from behind the counter-- "They're still cooling off." You can see a small tray that has about six caramel covered apples that you see are still gleaming in the little bit of light that's coming from the cloudy sky.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. That's what I wanted!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I haven't had one of those in such a long time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to buy one for all of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, that's going to be--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have to share one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Two copper each. For seven, that'll put you at 14 copper."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. How much does that add up to in silver?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One silver, four copper.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I pass it over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There's six caramel apples here, and you have seven with you."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's okay. No, it gets stuck in your teeth.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll take the candy, because I've never had it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Candy apple, all right, for you and the six for you. (shouting) All out of caramel apples for "the time being, but return here in an hour!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: An hour! You have to wait because we got all of them! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's this little girl across the way who's like--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw. I cut a little slice off and give her one little slice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You approach, and she gets scared. As you get closer you can see she looks a little disheveled. Probably one of the less well-off people of the city of Zadash. You don't see a parental figure in the near vicinity.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where's your mama? Do you have a mama? Is she around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just runs off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, I was going to give you more, but okay. Goodbye.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we go after her? I can hunt her down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While I start to enjoy my apple, I would like to look around and see if there are any book stalls or book barrels.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those festive book stalls.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A barrel of books!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Candied books, candied books!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The little girl disappeared into the crowd, or did she join a bunch of other kids?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She disappeared into the crowd.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Perception, you said?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Throw a dart. Win a book.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does not appear that there is a strong presence of tome and/or book retailers as part of the celebration, unfortunately.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, while I was looking round, is there anything besides games and food?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Most everyone out here, it's a craft fair on top of being a celebratory-- There's a bunch of random odds and ends that people collect or purchase to add to their home interior.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Huge long shot probably a no, but do I also see anything about the Cobalt Soul here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing about, you do see the occasional person of the Cobalt Soul robes, but they're not selling anything here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to run up behind: Caleb, have you run Detect Magic on any of this?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, you know, I tried to do a little stuff on the sly a little while ago and didn't work out so well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just, there's so much. I figure something's got to be interesting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, if you can keep eyes off of me for a moment, I can do that if you like.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can absolutely do that. I'm going to run towards the tapestry booth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you can see, it's a long, thin cart that's mainly things on display. It looks like it's two wooden dowel rods at each side of this booth, that all push together at the center. All the tapestries are hung over the side on display for the front end. There's three individuals that are manning this booth. There isn't a whole lot of transaction going on there. It's a little more of a specialty item in the sense that not everyone needs to fill their place with tapestries. They're on display.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm seeing if there's anything deeply gaudy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, actually. There is one that is an insignia or an interpretation of the symbol of the Platinum Dragon. It is silver threads among a standard sky-blue coloring. There's several different dragon heads that are woven into the pattern. There's almost an embroidery. For as much as you've known about the Platinum Dragon and the religion, it's surprisingly gaudy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm trailing about 40 feet behind Molly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's beautiful. How much is that, then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of the people running the booth, quickly, as you see a mid-30s, half-elf man with a bit of chin scruff and very short hair, leans around the corner and goes, "Oh, for the Platinum "Dragon. This one was handcrafted by me and my mate, over the period of about two months. Hand "embroidered. Very difficult. Very exquisite. For the entire piece, the central piece you're "inquiring about, that'll run you about ten gold pieces. We have smaller, almost doily-sized "renditions of it back here."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How big is this piece, out of curiosity?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes the back and unfolds it entirely but can't quite get the full arm length to get up there. He's like, "This one's about six and a half, seven feet from top to bottom. Can be used "as a rug, should you be so inclined and you aren't quite a fan of the Platinum Dragon and want him "beneath your feet--"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's purchased. Ten gold? My god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right away!" He takes it, begins folding it up with one of his other compatriots. They take the twine and manage to fasten it in three places.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bless you, master craftsmen! My god. It is such a rendition of the Platinum Dragon that I've never seen before. I clutch at my Platinum Dragon brooch. It's beautiful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He says, "We're happy to bring joy to you and the house of your great deity." They hand you this relatively massive tapestry that's almost seven feet end to end.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I have fucking plans, people! Swing it over my shoulder, and I'll be walking around like a pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's this small, forum-like circular stone building that's been emptied and closed. Now there's crowds walking in and out the front doorway, and around it are where a lot of these games are set up. You do see one that has a big banner that says Eagle Shot. There is one large, central platform where it looks like this is where a lot of public presentations are given here in the Pentamarket. It's currently set up with a central table and a number of members of the Righteous Brand, as well as one that is a

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where in relation to all of this is the Hearth of the Allhammer? Because I know it's in the Pentamarket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Hearth of the Allhammer would be on the other side of this large, forum-like structure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to walk over to the Eagle Shot, was it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eagle Shot, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's that game look like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a series of trees that are at the very back that mark what would normally be an alcove in this small park, but within this alcove there are three archery targets that are slightly off from each other at different distances. They have a rack with different bows and a whole cache of arrows that are set to the side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter) I'm just standing there like, what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bows? Nah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You could do it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's too hard to pull it back! This thing does it for you, look. (click)

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe they'll let you use it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I guess I could go ask. Excuse me, sir or madam?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The first guard turns around. "Oh, little girl, good to see you. What can I help you with?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm wondering if you have to use a bow and arrow to compete or can you use one of these?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What do you-- " Which, you still have a bolt nocked in this hand crossbow. He's like, "Put the-- "

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not going to fire it at you! I don't have anything wrong with it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Little miss, you shouldn't be waving that around in public. I'm not sure how you got a hold "of that. Where's your mother?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My father is over there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you want to play this game?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, papa.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Unfortunately, by the rules you have to use one of the provided bows."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This one is pretty good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Please put-- sir, your daughter is a danger to the general public right now."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, she is an excellent shot. She's trained.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, she has not been trained proper use of that in a space in which is it safe for other "people to be around. I'm just saying."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure. How much to play your game?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Could I see that for a second?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My daughter's crossbow, you want?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Would either of you like to play some Eagle Shot?" Behind them, somebody like--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The other guard behind is currently setting up an older woman who is in the process of getting the arrow lined up, and it keeps falling out of her grip and the other guard's like, "No, put it "here," and getting ready. Finally fires an arrow and it goes and disappears past one of the trees, "Oh, no!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, you know, I'll tell you something. If you want to have a laugh, let's have me do some physical sports, so that should be pretty good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That'll be fun. All right, let's do it. We will both enter your competition.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's no mouth. There's like, matted twine hair, some felt-like material that's made a crown and a cape. "Of our fine King Bertrand Dwendal."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just a question for you. Should I hit the one in the back, which is highly likely, could we have the doll's weight in rats instead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He gives you a look like you said a bad word. He goes, "I suppose."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How far is the farthest one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He glances back. "It's probably about 80 feet."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's try.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott, I really want that wooden sword.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You don't have a sword, do you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Creepy little doll, man!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't listen to Fjord.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Get the doll. I bet it's cursed!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't work with this kind of pressure!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott. If you get that sword, I'll give you my jade bracelet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh man!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is this an attack roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He said about 80 feet, but the farthest one's about 100 feet. Which means it is in its second range increment, so the one in the back is at disadvantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not proficient in this thing at all, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Who's going first, if you don't mind me asking?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let me show my daughter how it is done.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're all right in their construction.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Watch my form and technique. I pick up the bow, and I take the stick thing. I pull it back like this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, continue."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (sneezes)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which target are you aiming for?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The farthest one, obviously.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Add your dexterity modifier.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I do not think you're proficient--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Aww, no, not at all. That is a three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. No, you are not.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it just simple weapons, or is it simple ranged weapons?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it's simple ranged weapons, but those count as simple weapons.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Simple weapons, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It gets about 40 or so feet before it gets stuck in the dirt. He's like, "That was good."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hmm. The

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think it's fletch-- yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Listen, I have read a lot of books. I know it is

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You nock your secondary arrow. Take a shot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nope. Dang it. The second rolls are always really good! That is an eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one gets about five feet further and almost hits a squirrel. You hear (squeaking), and it darts off into a nearby bush.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You could have got your own prize!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One more shot. You can do this!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is not well-crafted. I grab my wire that I use for the message spell, and I put my hair into a little ponytail.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You shouldn't use wire to do that, Caleb.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It damages your hair.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (pew) Okay. Oh no. Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one gets 40 feet, which is halfway there, before it hits the ground and sticks into the dirt. As soon as it finishes, there's like a, "That was good. Go fetch that." The other guard runs out and grabs the arrows to retrieve them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That went as well as I expected it to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is surprising. Well, a fine Harvest Close to you, friend, and for your daughter."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, it's my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hands the bow over, and a set of three arrows.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's going with the dice jail dice! You should not have done that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I add proficiency and--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Proficiency and your dex mod.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one arcs. It almost gets near the target, but ends up veering off to the right and ends up vanishing behind one of the secondary targets near the tree. He says, "Yeah, that was "better than your father."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is that? 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one hits the actual base of the far target. Misses the target entirely, but it hits the actual plank of wood that's holding it up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: See, the beads have a little bit of like, gold embossing, etching inside of them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Far target. 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It hits the bottom of the target. No bullseye, but you hit it. He's like, "That was "actually very good."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shut up! I don't need you to condescend to me! Give me another one!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right away, little missy." Grabs three more arrows.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I slap down the silver for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. It was two, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One silver for three shots.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I put down two silver.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six more shots, all right. "There you go."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She won't need six more shots.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two, in quick succession. 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you pull back, perfect bullseye into the farthest target. There's this brief pause as the guard spins around and goes, "What-- "

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not done! I get four more shots! Two in quick succession to the middle one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it still disadvantage to the middle target?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Middle one is not at disadvantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, well then. Should I reroll? Okay. I will still use your shitty dice. Two 23s.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both arrows-- we're talking, like, Disney Robin Hood-style, one arrow, next one splits the first arrow. The guard's still recovering from the first bullseye, he's like, "What?!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then two more. To the short one. 16 and a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both hit at the same time. The guard looks slowly over towards you. "Well done."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now go home and get your fucking shinebox.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Here's your doll."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And the sword?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Two swords."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Two swords!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I thought it was the rats--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Two rats."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Double rats!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Double rats, yeah. That's it? Because I thought that was dinner. We have--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're not eating the rats.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll find some other dinner, Yasha.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's my favorite.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You now have in your inventory: two rats in rat cages, two wooden swords--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can have

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, thanks!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yasha, do you eat rat a lot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A hand-stitched doll of King Bertrand Dwendal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a really good doll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it really is. Would you like the rats?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, were you going to eat one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we can share.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Alive, or do you cook it?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, I like to have it cooked. It falls off the bone. It's like a nice--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I can wait. I guess.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It really depends on what you have at your disposal. Yeah?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Later. It'll be a celebratory-- we could candy them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or caramel them!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Let's try it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I start to wander away towards the Allhammer?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look, guys. I'm Molly. Look! I want to go over to the military booth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't cut yourself!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While this is happening, Jester, you make your way around the large forum, and there you see the Hearth of the Allhammer. You've passed it before, and you can see it's the domed, iron structure. It's been left to rust a bit at the edges. The tops of the dome are polished where it's easily accessible, but the very peak of the dome is a little bit red, brown, rusted. There are a number of open arches in the inside, and you see the large, central forge that marks the center of the temple.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there a statue of the Allfather? The Allhammer guy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do see the large anvil that marks there has the symbol of the Allfather printed on each side and acts as both a ceremonial anvil for the creation of religious artefacts and items as part of worship and as the central statue for worship itself. That is the closest thing there is in this temple to a central focus of worship.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nott, be real careful with that doll; they put little spirits of kids in those.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there any guards around or are they mostly gone because of the celebration?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are three individuals that are manning the interior of the temple, one of which is the herald. Each temple in the city has a herald that's the keeper of that temple. It's a female dwarf, dark brown hair and three long braids that trail past to the middle back with a chainmail robe on that descends past the knees and is currently sitting on a bench and eating dried meat out of a small pouch and people watching as people walk by the temple. Nobody's in there actively worshipping at the moment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I go inside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Burn the place down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you go in trying to avoid attention or are you announcing yourself as you arrive?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. I'm going to casually walk in. Just, you know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you walk in, a voice in the corner from the direction of where the herald was goes, "Miss, "if you need something, don't be afraid to let me know. We're just sitting around."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I should have disguised myself first. I leave. Go literally right around the corner and disguise myself, and I come right back in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you disguise yourself as?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Disguise Self as an old woman-- oof, who just burped?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it wasn't me. With like a really tight bun and little teeny glasses and a cane. I guess I can't make myself have a cane, can I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that's not an extension of--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, well I walk kind of hunched over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you come around the corner and make your way in, you saunter in the far end of the temple through one of the arches that marks the interior, come in through the shadow and the herald once again goes, "If you need something, right over here."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (grumbling)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, that's fine." Goes back to-- (chuckles) already seems taken aback by your presence. What do you want to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there anybody in there? Nobody's in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, I mean, there's people in there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispered) Oh, shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's the herald who's sitting in the back eating on the opposite end of the anvil and there's two other folks that are on the outskirts of the arches, looking out into the crowd, just people watching.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to walk around to the back end of the anvil and act like I'm praying, but I'm going to wait until it looks like they're all looking the other direction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you begin to pray, the two others that are on the outside, who've noticed you enter, their attention doesn't wander to you for too long before they go back out to the celebration, people walking by and people watching in general. You're on the opposite side of the anvil from the herald who's still chewing on her meat. What do you want to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would like to get my paint set out and paint pink hearts all over the back side of the anvil along with "The Traveler was here". Then I'm going to leave a couple travel brochures for the Traveler. Yeah, I think that's good but they're sizeable hearts. I want nice pretty pink, all over the hammer. The anvil.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just for the sake of presentation because you're doing this with a bit of haste, knowing that you're under pressure. Go ahead and roll a performance check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. As you quickly begin to finish this heart, Traveler was here, you hear (yawning) across the way from the herald. You stop for a second-- no reaction. Continue going. You finish up the art piece. One of the other guardians of the temple begins to turn around and walk back towards the herald and you pull back for a moment, but they turned away from you and it seems that you've managed to go this far without being noticed. You finish up your last heart, the exclamation point and the underline of the Traveler.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, and I'm going to take some sequins off of my sequins glove and sprinkle it on there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (tinkling)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A little granny painting furiously.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just (straining). You put the pamphlets there on the side, slip them beneath the offering bowl at the base of it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want one sitting right on top of the anvil. Then I'm going to leave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a sleight of hand check on that one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because that will be creeping into the view of the herald.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you place it on top, the voice on the opposite end goes, "Do you need help there? "Dearie?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah. I walk away.

lines.name: MATT
